snippet: Discussions aimed at securing access to restricted sites — where the United Nations believes scientists may have tested explosives that could be used on nuclear warheads — stalled on Friday.
abstract: Impetus toward resolving the nuclear dispute with Iran slows further as senior inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency say they have made no gains in accessing restricted sites they suspect of being used to test potential triggers for nuclear warheads.

byline.contributor: Artin Afkhami contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Discussions aimed at securing access to restricted sites — where the United Nations believes scientists may have tested explosives that could be used on nuclear warheads — stalled on Friday.

headline.seo: Nuclear Agency Talks With Iran Stall Over Access to Sites
headline.main: ‘No Progress’ in Iran Nuclear Talks, U.N. Inspectors Report
headline.print_headline: Nuclear Talks Stall as Iran Bars Access To Inspectors
